title: Transfer news: The latest rumours from Man Utd, Chelsea, Arsenal and all the top teams
text:
0 22-Mar-2017 01:00:00 Goal summarises the biggest transfer talk from the Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, the Bundesliga and beyond MAN UTD EYE ALDERWEIRELD 
Manchester United are considering a summer move for Tottenham defender Toby Alderweireld, reports Yahoo Sport UK . 
The Belgian currently has a £25 million release clause in his contract, although Spurs are locked in talks regarding fresh terms at White Hart Lane. PL PAIR TABLE KOLASINAC OFFERS 
Arsenal and Liverpool have tabled offers for Schalke's in-demand defender Sead Kolasinac, according to Bild . 
The highly-rated left-back will be out of contract in the summer, with AC Milan, Juventus and Roma also keen on acquiring his services. ATLETICO CHASE LACAZETTE 
Atletico Madrid are hoping to convince Antoine Griezmann to stay by making a grand gesture of signing Alexandre Lacazette to play with him instead of replacing the Frenchman, The Sun reports . 
Though the capital club have been banned from signing players this summer by FIFA, they hope to have it overturned and will go for the 25-year-old Lyon sensation. Griezmann has been linked to Manchester United while Lacazette has also been touted as a Premier League target, but the Rojiblancos could make a big statement if they have both strikers in their ranks next season. MAN UTD EYE OX-CHAMBERLAIN 
Manchester United are interested in signing Arsenal midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain this summer, according to the Daily Mirror . 
The England international looks likely to leave north London at the end of this season, and United are monitoring his situation as Jose Mourinho looks to add to his squad. PSG MAKE WENGER OFFER 
Paris Saint-Germain have offered Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger a two-year contract to take over at Parc des Princes, according to The Sun . 
The Ligue 1 champions are set to sack Unai Emery after a disappointing first year in charge and are hopeful of tempting Wenger back to his homeland should he leave Arsenal. ARSENAL TARGET LACAZETTE 
Lyon striker Alexandre Lacazette tops Arsenal's striker shortlist ahead of a summer rebuild in north London, according to the Daily Mirror . 
Arsene Wenger is planning for life without Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil, and the likes of Kylian Mbappe, Marco Reus and Moussa Dembele are also on the Gunners's list of targets. BAKAYOKO FAVOURS CHELSEA 
Monaco midfielder Tiemoue Bakayoko favours a move to Chelsea this summer, according to The Sun . 
Manchester United are also keen on the Ligue 1 star, but Antonio Conte sees him as a good long-term option for his squad at Stamford Bridge. LIVERPOOL ENTER KEANE RACE 
Liverpool are the latest club to show an interest in signing Burnley defender Michael Keane, according to the Daily Mail . 
Manchester United and Chelsea have both previously been linked with the centre-back, and now the Reds are set to battle their rivals at the end of the campaign. SIMEONE FREE TO LEAVE ATLETICO 
Manager Diego Simeone is free to leave Atletico Madrid this summer, according to CalcioMercato . 
Reports had suggested the Argentine had a €50 million release clause in his contract, but it has now been confirmed that is not the case were Inter or Arsenal to make their move. BARCA SEEK COUTINHO 
Barcelona are ready to move for Liverpool playmaker Philippe Coutinho in the summer transfer window, according to the Mirror . 
The Catalans' midfield is far from settled, and with Andres Iniesta possibly leaving at the end of 2018, Coutinho and PSG star Marco Verratti are Barca's top candidates to replace the legend. CITY READY TO SPLASH OUT ON BONUCCI 
Pep Guardiola is looking to strengthen his Manchester City defence with a massive bid for Leonardo Bonucci, according to the Daily Star . 
City's defensive frailties have cost them dearly this season, having conceded six over two legs against Monaco to exit the Champions League. 
But Bonucci would not come cheap, with the Juventus star carrying an estimated asking price of £50 million. SHAW LOOKING FOR UNITED EXIT 
Out-of-favour Manchester United defender Luke Shaw is desperate to kickstart his career away from Old Trafford, according to the Daily Star . 
Stoke City, Newcastle United and Crystal Palace are all monitoring Shaw's situation should he leave, following a season where he has barely featured under Jose Mourinho. ARSENAL APPROACH TUCHEL 
Arsenal have already made contact with Thomas Tuchel in their bid to find a replacement for manager Arsene Wenger, according to Bild . 
While the Frenchman is yet to declare whether he will stay at the Emirates, his future is extremely uncertain — and the Borussia Dortmund coach has been identified as a worthy successor. MAN CITY CONFIDENT ON MESSI 
Manchester City believe that they can take advantage of Barcelona's reluctance to meet Lionel Messi's wage demands this summer, reports the Sunday Express . 
Pep Guardiola is to be given £200 million to spend in the next transfer window, plus whatever he makes from sales, with a raid on his former employers at Camp Nou figuring prominently in his thoughts. CHELSEA & CITY LODGE COMAN BIDS 
Chelsea and Manchester City have tabled £43 million offers for Bayern Munich loan star Kingsley Coman, according to The Sun . 
The German champions are hoping to strike a permanent £18m deal this summer, but the Frenchman's parent club, Juventus, would prefer to sell to another team for a higher price. ARSENAL WANT BARKLEY 
Arsenal have joined the race to sign wantaway Everton attacker Ross Barkley, according to the Daily Mirror . 
The England international, 22, will be sold by the Toffees this summer if he does not sign a new contract with the club. 
Chelsea and Tottenham are among the other Premier League teams believed to be keen to snap up Barkley should he leave Goodison Park. INTER & SEVILLA WANT SON 
Inter and Sevilla have both made enquiries regarding the availability of Tottenham forward Heung-Min Son, according to the Evening Standard . 
The South Korea international is currently enjoying his best season at White Hart Lane but could be tempted away by the promise of more regular football. UNITED & MADRID WANT SCHMEICHEL 
Real Madrid have added Leicester City's Kasper Schmeichel to the goalkeeping shortlist for the summer, according to Don Balon . 
Los Blancos have been impressed with the Dane's performances in the Champions League this season, though they could face competition from Manchester United. Related
